episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and intriguing topics, including plastic surgery for pet fish in Singapore, the correlation between attractiveness and success in the Tour de France, the history of competitive typesetting in the 19th century, and the export of fresh air from Britain to China.

facts.fact: In Singapore, pet fish have plastic surgeons.
According to scientists, you're more likely to win the Tour de France if you're good looking.
In the 19th century, setting type for newspapers was a competitive sport.
Britain exports fresh air to China.
